remarks: The chain rule for derivatives at a point.  For the (more general) relation version, see ~ dvcobr .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Aug-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 10-Feb-2015.)
statement:
dvco.f $e |- ( ph -> F : X --> CC ) $.
dvco.x $e |- ( ph -> X C_ S ) $.
dvco.g $e |- ( ph -> G : Y --> X ) $.
dvco.y $e |- ( ph -> Y C_ T ) $.
dvco.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. { RR , CC } ) $.
dvco.t $e |- ( ph -> T e. { RR , CC } ) $.
dvco.df $e |- ( ph -> ( G ` C ) e. dom ( S _D F ) ) $.
dvco.dg $e |- ( ph -> C e. dom ( T _D G ) ) $.
dvco $p |- ( ph -> ( ( T _D ( F o. G ) ) ` C ) = ( ( ( S _D F ) ` ( G ` C ) ) x. ( ( T _D G ) ` C ) ) ) $.
